text: <@U6740K1SP> I don't think so - there are a bunch of plausible hypotheses, but all of them are hard to test in humans

text: isn't it in general the case that illnesses in children are often less dangerous? I seem to remember something about measles easily killing adults while children survive more often (unvaccinated, that is)
